page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: Bishopton has a railway station on the Glasgow to Gourock line. There are four trains an hour in each direction. Bishopton has three bus services. Clydeside Scottish provide 2 routes _ 23 Glasgow to Largs and 610 Bishopton to Paisley; both travel via Erskine. Strathclyde PTE run a night service between Glasgow and Bishopton. Also free buses are run each day from Bishopton to supermarkets in Erskine, Paisley and Renfrew. Bishopton is by_passed by the M8 motorway which has made the local roads a lot quieter. Joined to the M8 is the Erskine Bridge, a toll bridge across the Clyde which improves road links in the West of Scotland. Also near Bishopton (8km) is Glasgow Airport with services to Britain and Europe.
